line_1: Could from his wretched race, for childish hire,
line_2: Allow one moment, that a Savage sire

line_1: To feed her hungry brats must spin for hire.
line_2: Whose yearly-breeding wife, in mean attire,

line_1: And reign o'er distant provinces for hire?
line_2: Or shall I to Brabantia's courts retire,

line_1: With Honourable Russians in their Hire,
line_2: Was to behold the Nations all on Fire,

line_1: With Honourable Russians in their Hire,
line_2: Most Christian Kings, inflam'd by black Desire,

line_1: With Honourable Russians in their Hire,
line_2: Of this sad Work when Each begins to tire,

line_1: Appeas'd, tho' Lais gain'd her Hire;
The Pandar slave who lets his spouse for hire,
line_2: Here mark the thankless child, the unnatural sire,
